core.net

Class WriteTransfer

  • java.lang.Object
    • core.net.Transfer
      • core.net.WriteTransfer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class WriteTransfer
extends Transfer
    Write Transfer Runnable transfer moves a file from this location to an external endpoint. A write operation chunks a file into block sized packets and writes them to a socket. Example ( new Thread( new WriteTransfer(ENDPOINT, "myTestFile") )).start()

      • getAcknowledge

        public AckMessage getAcknowledge()
                          throws java.io.IOException,
                                 InvalidMessageException,
                                 ErrorMessageException,
                                 MessageOrderException,
                                 java.net.SocketTimeoutException
        Synchronously blocks and waits for an acknowledgment from the socket endpoint
        Returns:
        An acknowledge message
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - - If the socket is closed
        InvalidMessageException - - If the received message has an invalid encoding
        ErrorMessageException - - If an error message is received
        MessageOrderException - - If an acknowledge is received out of order
        java.net.SocketTimeoutException - - If an acknowledge packet isn't received within TIMEOUT_TIME
